name: The Carlton Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights and absolutely loved it! The staff were fantastic and very helpful - nothing was too much trouble.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel!

reviews.text: Our room was huge, clean and comfortable. Room service was good and the food lovely. The room had a fridge which was fantastic! WiFi available.
reviews.title: staff quality

reviews.text: Parking is not available on the hotel grounds but the hotel does offer a voucher towards cost of parking at multi-level car park which is only a 3 minute walk from the hotel.
reviews.title: Perfect Location

reviews.text: The hotel is centrally located in Edinburgh and only minutes walk away from the city's attractions. We would definitely be staying here again - and would certainly recommend it to anyone considering staying there!
reviews.title: Good central location

reviews.text: I would like to thank your restaurant waitress NICOLE for the care and attention she gave me and my friends when we stayed in the Carlton recently.
reviews.title: Faultless

reviews.text: I was in Edinburgh on a somewhat impulsive, short notice trip to the festival over the bank holiday weekend,stayed in this hotel for one night and I was delighted to get a room here at a deeply discounted rate including breakfast and free wifi.
reviews.title: Great location. Good value. Wonderful staff

reviews.text: As well as being perfectly placed for the Royal Mile and the festival, it's fantastically placed for waverley station, which was really important to me as I arrived at around 7am from the Caledonian Sleeper. I knew I would be too early to check in, but was really welcomed by the front desk staff and who stored my bags for me and offered me a reduced price breakfast voucher.
reviews.title: Over priced, noisy and tired.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast buffet was excellent with a wide range of hot and cold breakfast items. Including several delicious types of preserves and lemon curd (in jars rather than those impossible to open plastic packets. I don't drink tea, coffee or fruit juice so cant comment on those, but I was a bit disappointed that there was no sparkling mineral water available (my breakfast tipple of choice) on the buffet.
reviews.title: Oh dear, oh dear, oh dear but great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was out all day and only got to see my room at around 11 pm. It is a huge hotel and my room was right at the end of the corridor overlooking the High Street, so quite a long walk from the lift. There were also a couple of steps to negotiate, not a big deal for most people but this might be an issue for someone with mobility issues or heavy luggage. My room was enormous with large windows. It was very comfortable and the air on was easy to control. The room was quite noisy, but this is only to be expected during the festival. I had to leave early the next morning to catch some shows, so literally only slept and showered in the room so didn't have time to do a detailed check on the condition of the room, but it looked fine. The décor wasnt really to my taste but wasn't offensive.
reviews.title: Pleasent stay

reviews.text: Overall, I thought this was a great hotel. The price (£140 per night) was terrific for a festival weekend especially as it included breakfast and wifi. The staff were friendly and helpful and my stay was a pleasure Although this was my first leisure visit to Edinburgh, I have made over 150 business trips to Edinburgh over the last 15 years and have stayed at most of the 4/5 star hotels there and this is as good as most of them and significantly better than many. I would recommend it wholeheartedly especially if you can get a discounted rate.
reviews.title: excellent location and great staff

reviews.text: This hotel is in a fantastic location, close to the train station and right on top of the Royal Mile. I stayed here during the Edinburgh Festival so very busy but the reception staff were very helpful and smiley. The room was just big enough to fit the queen size bed and a chair, it did however have a good size flat tv and the bathroom was modern and above all clean. By far the biggest problem if you are staying in this hotel is that even though it was at best 19c outside, the room was very hot, no air con although the reception team did supply a fan, the windows only open a couple of inches and the road noise is substantial as you would expect.
reviews.title: Top location but......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here as part of our honeymoon and couldn't have been more satisfied with our stay. We didn't like the view from the room we was given so with a lovely talk with a lady on reception we had our room changed to a turret room witha view of the royal mile. The room was very comfortable, everything was clean and fresh. The staff were all very polite and helpfull, nothing was too much.Breakfast was really good and filled us up for busy days with lots of walking. We enjoyed an evening in the bar after the royal tattoo and found this to be relaxed and comfortable. In all our stay was very comfortable and enjoyable and helped to make this part of our honeymoon enjoyable.
reviews.title: Lovely Honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would definately recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay central in edinburgh and will definately consider staying here again if we visit in the future.
reviews.title: It started well but---

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The very pleasant receptionist told us we had been upgraded to a premier room on the 5th floor.The room was large but a peculiar shape with a turret like window with good views but the furnishing was an odd mix of pieces.Although we were only staying 1 night housekeeping disturbed us at 9 am,asking when they could do the room.Breakfast certainly ended at 10am when staff descended on the buffet lines removing everything,despite a number of tables having been recently occupied. I only got a hot breakfast when I complained about this.The toaster kept breaking down further delaying people. I would not wish to stay here again.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel and breakfast !!!!

reviews.text: Me and my husband stayed at this hotel for a couple of nights and the reception staff were extremely helpful and friendly. The rooms were really comfortable and the breakfast was the best I have ever had in a hotel. The buffet breakfast had everything you ever wanted - cereals, fruits, different breads, dried fruits, fruit juices, huge choice of hot dishes and porridge. The waiting staff were smart, helpful and eager to top up hot drinks. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to people and I will definitely be staying here again on my next trip to Edinburgh. Enjoy !!! .....
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: 30 of us got together for a long weekend family reunion. The hotel is perfectly situated for shops, restaurants, sight-seeing, pubs and anything else you can think of. The staff were all great, and the food was lovely. Train station is really close by too and the hotel is on many bus routes. The biggest let down is the spa, I have stayed a few times and the bubble pool is never working, which is really disappointing when it is part of the treat of staying in a hotel with a spa!
reviews.title: Family reunion

reviews.text: Stayed here on Wednesday 22nd of August for one night to attend the fringe. Hotel is in a great location being adjacent to the train stain station and at the same time being minutes from the centre of the festival. Staff were very courteous and friendly and resolved a query/confusion very quickly and without fuss.
reviews.title: Great Location, Clean and Comfortable Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was very nice with fantastic views of the city and with one of the largest flat screen TV's I have seen in a hotel and with Free Wi-Fi. Would defintley reccomend this hotel for a weekend break to Edinburgh. The only two negatives were that the residents bars closed at 2am but to be fair our group of 6 were only people in there and it was a wednesday and secondly the room rate of £155 didnt include breakfast. This is one of my pet hates with Hotels as I see it as a stealth tax which I would expect from a budget brand but not a 4* hotel.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, friendly staff but can be noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However that said these two negatives had no impact on my overall opinion and would not prevent me from staying here again.
reviews.title: Excellent location..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second visit and as before we liked the room, the food, the bar and the staff who were helpful and friendly throughout our stay. It's very convenient for Waverley Station but when booking make sure you ask about the low level entrance to the hotel that can save you a climb from the station up to North Bridge Street.
reviews.title: A curate's egg

description: The four-star Carlton Hotel Edinburgh is right in the heart of Scotland's historic capital city, situated on North Bridge overlooking the Royal Mile. Just minutes from Princes Street and Edinburgh Castle, with 189 bedrooms it's the perfect base for exploring what the city has to offer. Take the Edinburgh Dungeon Tour, unearth the city's history at the National Museum of Scotland then take in the spectacular views of the skyline from Arthur's Seat. Get your heart rate up in the squash courts, pamper yourself in the spa and beauty rooms then enjoy excellent local food in the contemporary Bridge Restaurant.
